title: {{childName}} and the Path to Granny's House

scenes.text:
In a house on a hill lived {{childName}} one day,
With a Mama so loving in every loving way.
The sun was bright-bright, the sky was blue,
What a wonderful day for me and for you!

But then came a sound from the room down the hall,
"Oh dear!" said Mama. "Oh my! Oh small!
Poor Granny is sick in her house far away,
She needs some love on this bright, sunny day!"

"Can I help?" asked {{childName}} with eyes big and round,
"Can I help make Granny feel safe and sound?"
"Yes indeed!" said Mama with love in her voice,
"You're the perfect helper - what a good choice!"

Mama packed goodies in a basket so neat,
Yummy-sweet cookies and cakes good to eat!
"Take these," said Mama, "to Granny's place,
They'll put a big smile on her dear, sweet face!"

"Now {{childName}}, my dear one, before you go,
There are some important things you should know:
Stay on the path - it's safe and it's right,
Don't talk to strangers, day or night!

Don't wander or wonder to left or to right,
Keep on the path and you'll be alright!
If someone asks questions, just smile and say 'Hi,'
Then hurry on by, like a bird in the sky!"

{{childName}} took up that basket with care,
"I'll help dear Granny! I'll show how much I care!"
Off to the woods with a hop-skip-hop,
Following the path - clip, clop, clip, clop!

The trees were tall, the flowers bright,
Birds singing songs in the morning light!
Yellow and purple and pink flowers grew,
Red ones and orange and bright green-blue too!

But what do you think came along the way?
A Wolf with a smile on this bright sunny day!
"Well, well!" said Wolf, "Where are you going?
Your basket looks heavy - the top's overflowing!"

"I'm going to Granny's!" said {{childName}} with glee,
"She's sick and she's sad, as sad as can be!
I've got yummy treats to make her feel better,
Cookies and cakes - I'm love's little getter!"

"How nice!" said the Wolf with a grin so wide,
"But look all around! Look far and side!
Pretty flowers everywhere, here and there,
Flowers to pick with love and with care!

Your Granny would love them, don't you think so?
Yellow ones and red ones all in a row!"
{{childName}} looked left, {{childName}} looked right,
"What should I do? What would be right?"

choices.label: I'll stay on the path like Mama said true!
I'll pick pretty flowers - wouldn't you?

scenes.text:
"No-no," said {{childName}}, "I'll stay where it's right,
Mama knows best from morning till night.
I'll stick to the path, I'll do what she said,
I'll keep my two feet where it's safe to tread!"

The Wolf's grin wobbled, his eyes got thin,
But {{childName}} just smiled with a happy grin.
"Oh well," huffed Wolf, "perhaps another day,
I'll see you around!" Then he slunk away.

"That felt funny-strange," thought {{childName}} walking along,
"But doing what's right can't be wrong!
Step-step-step down the path so neat,
Moving along on happy feet!"

That Wolf ran swiftly through the thick green trees,
Running and racing quick as you please!
"I'll get there first!" he said with a wheeze,
"My tricky plan will work with such ease!"

But then Wolf paused with a troubled frown,
"Is tricking others the right way around?
This doesn't feel good, this doesn't feel right..."
Then he shook his head, "Too late for that sight!"

Knock-knock-knock at Granny's front door,
"Who's there?" called Granny, weak and poor.
"It's {{childName}}, Granny! Let me come in!
I've brought you treats!" (What a fibbing grin!)

Poor Granny opened the door nice and wide,
Wolf asked politely, then stepped inside.
"Please rest right here while I tidy up neat,"
He helped her sit in her favorite seat!

And who should come strolling around and about?
Helpful Sam with eyes keen out!
This woodland friend who watches with care,
When something feels wrong in the forest air!
"That voice sounds rough, not gentle and sweet,
Something's not right from my head to my feet!"

"Oh yes indeed!" cried {{childName}} with glee,
"Pretty flowers for Granny from you and me!
Off the path I'll go with a bound and a hop,
To pick all the flowers - just a quick stop!"

"What a kind heart!" purred Wolf oh-so-sweet,
"Your Granny is lucky from her head to feet!
Tell me, dear child, where does she stay?
I'd love to visit some other day!"

"She lives by the oak trees down the hill,
In a house with roses by the windowsill!"
"How lovely!" said Wolf, then away he went,
While {{childName}} picked flowers to their heart's content!

Petals soft like a butterfly's wing,
Flowers that dance and flowers that sing!
Sweet-smelling flowers and bright ones too,
Every color from red to blue!
"Granny will smile when she sees what I bring,
These flowers will make her poor heart sing!"

{{childName}} hummed while picking flowers bright,
"Tra-la-la-la from morning till night!"
Daisies and roses for a cheerful hour,
Building a beautiful flower tower!

But while {{childName}} picked with loving care,
That sneaky Wolf was racing through the air!
Well, not really flying, but running quite fast,
To Granny's house first - he'd beat them at last!

But halfway there, Wolf slowed his racing pace,
"Maybe tricking isn't right for this place?
This feels all wrong, this feels unkind..."
Then he pushed those thoughts right out of his mind!

He crept so quietly with his most cunning grin,
"Let me inside! I have goodies within!"
He asked dear Granny to rest safe and sound,
Then put on her gown and laid himself down!

And strolling around came Helpful Sam,
A woodland friend with a watchful plan!
This forest helper patrols every day,
Keeping travelers safe along the way!
"That voice sounds different, rough and loud,
This doesn't seem right - I'm quite unbowed!"

{{childName}} walked up to Granny's front door,
But something felt different than times before.
The door was wide open, that wasn't quite right,
And the voice from inside gave them a small fright!

"Come in! Come in!" called a voice rumbly-deep,
Much louder than Granny's, gentle and sweet.
"Hello, Granny dear!" called {{childName}} outside,
"Are you feeling better?" (But something felt... tried?)

"YES-YES-YES!" boomed the voice from within,
"Don't wait out there - just come right in!"
But {{childName}}'s heart went thump-thump-thump,
"Something's not right - I feel a bump!"

choices.label: I'll look-look-look before I go in!
I followed the path, so let's begin!

scenes.text:
{{childName}} came with flowers bright,
But something at Granny's didn't feel right.
"Granny! I'm here with flowers for you!
Red ones and yellow and purple-pink too!"

"Come in, my dear!" came a rumbly roar,
Much louder than the time they'd heard it before.
{{childName}} looked at their flowers so pretty, so neat,
And remembered the Wolf that they chanced to meet.

"That Wolf was friendly, but now I feel... strange,
Like something about this just isn't the same.
My tummy has a little worry,
Should I slow down? Should I not hurry?"

choices.label: Maybe I should have been more wise today!
Everything's fine - let's go and play!

scenes.text:
"I'll peek and ponder," said {{childName}} so wise,
"That's the smart thing with my two eyes!"
They crept to the window, quiet as a mouse,
To take a quick peek, inside Granny's sweet house.

Oh my! Oh me! What a sight they did see!
A Wolf in the bed where Granny should be!
"Those ears are pointy! That grin is wide!
That's not my Granny!" {{childName}} cried.

Just then came Helpful Sam around,
"Worry-worry? I heard that sound!
I'm Sam the Helper, I watch and I care,
When something's not right, I'm always there!"

"There's a Wolf in Granny's bed!" cried {{childName}},
"He's got her nightcap on his big head!"

"Oh my-oh-yes!" said Sam with a grin,
"You figured that out! Smart as you've been!
Let's work together, you and me,
To help your dear Granny - one, two, three!"

"Quick as a wink!" said Sam with glee,
"We'll sneak as quiet as quiet can be!
You spotted the trick with your careful eyes,
Now let's give Wolf a big surprise!"

Tip-toe toe-tip to the cottage door neat,
Where Wolf lay snoring, quite sound and beat.
"Snore-snozzle-snore!" whispered Sam with joy,
"He's sleeping sound like a tired little boy!"

Safe in the closet, tucked away neat and small,
They found dear old Granny, safe after all!
"{{childName}}!" she whispered, "Oh my dear!
Your careful looking made everything clear!"

The Wolf woke up with "Ah-ah-ah-CHOO!"
And saw all three faces - what could he do?
"Oops-a-daisy!" said Wolf with shame,
"I guess you've won this silly game!"

"I did what Mama said was right-right-right,
So everything should be perfectly bright."
But walking closer, something felt queer,
A fluttery-flutter, a feeling of fear.

"Hello, Granny!" they called so sweet,
But the voice that came back was not such a treat!
Not scary or mean, just different-strange,
"What's this feeling? What's this change?"

"My tummy feels funny, my heart goes thump,
But I followed the rules - what's this little bump?
I did what was right, I stayed on the path,
So why do I feel like something's... not quite right on my behalf?"

{{childName}} peeked through the window with care,
And gasped at the Wolf lying there!
"I followed the path AND noticed my feeling,
Oh my! What a wonderful revealing!"

Just then came Helpful Sam around,
"Worry-worry? I heard that sound!
I'm Sam the Helper, I watch the wood,
Making sure all travelers feel good!"

"There's a Wolf in Granny's bed, it's true!
My rules and feelings both helped me too!"

Together they opened the cottage door,
Wolf was snoring loud on the floor.
In the closet, safe and sound,
Poor dear Granny could be found!

"You did two smart things today,"
Said Sam in a proud and happy way.
"You followed rules and felt what's wrong,
Together they helped you all along!"

{{childName}} walked over to the small cottage door,
But the feeling felt different than it had done before.
That voice inside sounded rumbly-deep,
"Hmm," thought {{childName}}, "that doesn't sound quite... sweet?"

"I met a Wolf who asked where Granny stays,
Maybe sharing wasn't wise in all ways?
I wanted to help and I wanted to care,
But was telling a stranger the right thing to share?"

The flowers looked pretty in their worried hand,
But slowly but surely they began to understand:
"Being kind is good, that much is true,
But being careful might be important too!"

"I'll peek-peek-peek," they said with care,
"To see what's happening in there."

{{childName}} peeked with flowers held tight,
And gasp-gasp-gasped at a most surprising sight!
In Granny's bed with her cap on so neat,
Sat that Wolf from the path, that earlier they did meet!

Just then came Helpful Sam along,
"You look worried - is something wrong?"
"The Wolf I met is in Granny's bed!
I think I learned something!" that's what {{childName}} said.

Quietly-quiet they opened the door,
Wolf was snore-snoring loud on the floor.
Safe in the closet, but still safe and sound,
Dear Granny was heard, and at long last was found!

"You learned something wise today,"
Said Granny with love in her gentle way.
"Your heart helped you care, but you learned to see,
That's how young children grow up to be!"

{{childName}} knocked with flowers bright,
"I brought pretty flowers to make you feel right!"
"Come in! Come in!" called the voice from the bed,
But something felt different, that's what their heart said.

"Granny sounds rumbly, like she's got a cold,
Different from gentle, from sweet and from old."
But {{childName}} felt loving and wanted to care,
"I'll help her feel better when I get there!"

They opened the door just a little bit wide,
And peeked at the figure on the bed just inside.
"Your nightcap looks funny, it covers your ears,
And Granny, your voice sounds quite different I fear."

Their caring heart whispered, "Something's not right,
But maybe she's sicker than usual tonight."

{{childName}} stepped closer but then stopped dead,
"Wait-wait-wait! That's not right!" they said.
The ears were pointy, the grin was wide,
"Something's quite different!" {{childName}} cried.

"You're NOT my Granny!" they said standing sure,
"My heart tells me so, and my eyes tell me more!
My Granny speaks softly, speaks gentle and sweet,
But your voice is rumbly from your head to your feet!

My dear Granny's voice is like songs birds sing,
But yours sounds rough like a bell that won't ring!"

Just then came Helpful Sam, running around,
"What-what-what's all that rumbly sound?
I'm Sam the Helper, I patrol each day,
Keeping trouble and worry away!"

"The Wolf is pretending!" {{childName}} cried,
"My heart helped me see through his sneaky disguise!"

The closet was opened, and looked in with care,
They found dear old Granny, safe and sound in there!
"Your loving heart saved me," Granny said,
"It knew I wasn't the one in that bed!"

Wolf sat up red-faced with shame,
"Your heart-smart thinking has ended my game!"

{{childName}}, you've been so careful and smart!
You listened to Mama right from the start.
You spotted Wolf's trick so clear-clear-clear,
And now everyone safe is gathered here!

Helpful Sam stands right by your side,
With a great big grin, so full of pride!
But {{childName}}, you can choose what to do,
The next step is really up to you!

You could work with Sam to help save the day,
Or use your own smarts in your own special way.
Both choices are good, both choices are neat,
You've made this adventure quite the treat!

choices.label: I'll help Sam save the day - hip hooray!
I'll use my smart thinking to save the day!

scenes.text:
{{childName}}, your heart has been kind all along,
Singing its beautiful, caring song!
Your love for Granny helped you see
That something was wrong as wrong can be!

Your flowers are pretty, your heart beats true,
And now you know just what to do!
You can ask for help with your caring heart,
Or use your own love to make a fresh start!

Both ways show kindness, both ways are sweet,
Your heart has made this day complete!

choices.label: My caring heart says get help quick-quick!
I'll help Granny with my heart-smart trick!

scenes.text:
{{childName}}, you've tried such wonderful things!
You learned new ways - oh, the joy that it brings!
You can choose with both kindness and smarts,
What a beautiful way to warm all our hearts!

Sometimes rules help and sometimes hearts do,
Together they make a wiser you!
You can use both to help right now,
Or trust what you've learned - and take a bow!

Wolf looks surprised at how you have grown,
"You figured me out with skills of your own!"
What will you choose in your own special way?
Both will make this a wonderful day!

choices.label: I'll use both my heart and my head to help!
I'll trust what I learned - hip-hip-yelp!

scenes.text:
Wolf looked up with a sheepish grin,
"Oh dear-oh-me, I did not win!
{{childName}} was too smart for my silly game,
Now I feel quite full of shame!

Your smart thinking taught me something new:
Being honest is better to do!"

"You see," said Sam with a happy smile,
"{{childName}} outsmarted you in style!
You stayed on the path like Mama said,
Then looked and listened before going ahead!"

Granny hugged {{childName}} oh-so-tight,
"Your careful ways made everything right!"

So {{childName}} learned that day so bright,
That being careful feels just right!
When you stay safe and think things through,
There's nothing that you cannot do!

Wolf sat up with embarrassed eyes wide,
"Your heart saw through my silly disguise!
Your caring heart taught me something new:
That kindness and honesty see us through!"

He helped untie Granny gently with care,
"Your heart helped you know I shouldn't be there!"

"My dear," said Granny, holding {{childName}} tight,
"Your loving heart helped you see what's not right.
Your kind heart is smart, it feels what's true,
It kept you safe when you didn't know what to do!"

Helpful Sam clapped, "Hip-hip-hooray!
Your heart helped save the day!"

So {{childName}} learned that hearts can be wise,
They help you see through a sneaky disguise!
When you listen to love but stay alert too,
Your heart will always see you through!

Wolf sat up with a wondering look,
"{{childName}} read me just like a book!
Your journey taught me something grand:
That wisdom comes when heart and head work hand in hand!"

Helpful Sam did a happy dance,
"{{childName}}, your growing deserves every glance!
You learned that different ways can be right,
When used together - what a wonderful sight!"

"My dear child," said Granny with love in her voice,
"You made such a wonderful choice!
Sometimes rules help to keep you safe,
Sometimes your heart shows you the way!"

So {{childName}} learned something grand that day:
There's more than just one perfect way!
When your head and heart work as good friends,
That's when the very best story begins!

Oh, the places you'll visit! Oh, the things you will see!
When your heart and your head work in harmony!
